solarization noun [U]
(SOIL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
biology
  specialized a method of preparing soil for planting by covering it with plastic in order to attract the energy of the sun and prevent unwanted plants and insects : soil solarization Soil solarization is a relatively new method for weed control that is still being tested.solarization treatment Overall, concentrations of some essential nutrients were higher with solarization treatment.

solarization noun [U]
(PHOTO)
the fact or process of giving light to a piece of photographic film or paper before the image is completely developed (= treated with chemicals to make the image appear), which changes the light and dark areas or colours of the printed image: She uses a solarization technique to produce her prints. He accidentally turned on the light during the development of an image and solarization occurred.
More examplesFewer examplesIn solarization, a negative or print is re-exposed to light during development.The effect of solarization and reversal of the image is perfectly invisible until development.Solarization is achieved in the darkroom by exposing photographic paper or film to light for a brief instant during the chemical development.
